hookVariants.headline: From AI Pilots to Proof
hookVariants.text: Three years ago, enterprise AI meant endless pilots that never shipped. Today, Artifically customers deploy production AI in 4 weeks, not 4 quarters. We built the infrastructure that turns AI theater into measurable outcomes—because if it doesn't move a KPI, it doesn't ship.

hookVariants.headline: End AI Theater. Ship Outcomes.
hookVariants.text: The enterprise AI market is drowning in proof-of-concepts that never see production. 73% of AI pilots fail to scale beyond the lab. We solved the deployment gap with security-first infrastructure, outcome-tracking, and governed rollouts that actually work at enterprise scale.

customerOutcomes.quote: Artifically turned our AI strategy from PowerPoints to production systems.
customerOutcomes.speaker: Director of Digital Innovation

customerOutcomes.quote: We went from reactive firefighting to predictive operations.
customerOutcomes.speaker: VP of Operations

customerOutcomes.metric: 18 months of HIPAA-compliant AI in production
customerOutcomes.quote: The audit trail capabilities gave us confidence to scale AI across patient data.
customerOutcomes.speaker: Chief Security Officer

values.name: Outcomes Over Output
values.oneLiner: If it doesn't move a KPI, it doesn't ship.
values.story: We killed our ML Insights feature after 90 days when customers reported zero business impact. The engineering team wasn't happy, but our retention metrics improved 23% when we focused on features that drove measurable outcomes.
values.antiValue: Building features because they're technically interesting
values.decisionRule: Every feature must have a success metric defined before development starts

values.name: Trust Is a Feature
values.oneLiner: Security and compliance aren't afterthoughts—they're product requirements.
values.story: We delayed our Series A launch by 6 months to complete SOC 2 Type II certification. That decision cost us $500K in runway but won us our first Fortune 50 customer who specifically chose us for our compliance posture.
values.antiValue: Moving fast and breaking things in enterprise environments
values.decisionRule: Security review is required before any feature touches customer data

values.name: No Black Boxes
values.story: Our fraud detection model achieved 94% accuracy, but customers couldn't explain decisions to auditors. We rebuilt with interpretable ML that hit 91% accuracy—and customers could explain every decision. Adoption increased 340%.
values.antiValue: Optimizing for model performance over business usability
values.decisionRule: If a business user can't explain the AI decision, we don't ship it

values.name: One Week to Evidence
values.oneLiner: Every AI deployment must show value within one business week.
values.story: We implemented 'evidence sprints'—one-week cycles where new AI models must demonstrate measurable business impact. If we can't prove value in 5 business days, we pivot or kill the project. This rule has saved us from 12 failed initiatives.
values.antiValue: Multi-month AI projects without measurable milestones
values.decisionRule: No AI project runs longer than 1 week without validated business impact

values.name: Build With, Not For
values.oneLiner: Our best features come from shadowing customer teams.
values.story: We spent 2 weeks embedded with an AP team at a Fortune 500 manufacturer. Watching them process invoices revealed 6 workflow gaps our engineering team never imagined. The resulting co-designed features increased processing speed by 67%.
values.antiValue: Building based on assumptions about user needs
values.decisionRule: Direct customer observation is required before building any new workflow feature

values.name: Default to Open Standards
values.oneLiner: Customer data portability isn't a feature request—it's a right.
values.story: We built export connectors for three major competitors, including Salesforce and ServiceNow. This decision seemed counterintuitive, but customers trust us more knowing they're never locked in. Our NPS score is 73, and 'data portability' is the #2 cited reason.
values.antiValue: Creating vendor lock-in through proprietary data formats
values.decisionRule: Every data format we create must have a standard export path

teamPods.description: Setting strategic direction and company culture

members.name: Sarah Chen
members.bio: I help enterprises deploy AI that actually works by building security-first infrastructure. Previously scaled ML platforms at Google Cloud. Outside work: rock climbing and terrible woodworking projects.

members.name: Marcus Rodriguez
members.bio: I architect systems that turn AI pilots into production deployments. Previously built ML infrastructure at Stripe. Outside work: brewing coffee and debugging my smart home.

members.name: Dr. Priya Patel
members.bio: I ship secure, scalable AI systems that enterprises can trust. Previously led ML security at Microsoft Azure. Outside work: training for marathons and reading sci-fi novels.

proofPool.quote: Artifically cut our AI deployment time from 16 weeks to 2 weeks.
The audit trail capabilities gave us confidence to scale AI across patient data.

catalyst.title: The Catalyst Moment
catalyst.story: In 2019, our founder watched countless brilliant companies struggle with fragmented AI solutions. That's when the vision crystallized: what if AI could be truly unified, intelligent, and transformative?
catalyst.decision: We decided to turn down three lucrative consulting contracts to build the infrastructure that turns AI pilots into production systems
catalyst.consequence: Six months later, we had our first enterprise customer who deployed AI in 2 weeks instead of 6 months
catalyst.impact: This moment sparked the creation of Artifically - where artificial intelligence meets genuine business transformation.
catalyst.vision: To democratize AI and make it accessible to every business, regardless of size or technical expertise.
catalyst.quote: We chose to build the future we wanted to see, not just the solutions clients were asking for.
catalyst.speaker: Sarah Chen, CEO & Co-founder
